constitutionalAuthorityStatementText:
[Congressional Record Volume 167, Number 10 (Tuesday, January 19, 2021)]
[House]
From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]
By Mr. BANKS:
H.R. 343.
Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuant
to the following:
The constitutional authority of Congress to enact this
legislation is provided by Article I, section 8 of the United
States Constitution, specifically clause 18 (relating to the
power to make all laws necessary and proper for carrying out
the powers vested in Congress).
[Page H203]

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Health.

title: Taxpayer Conscience Protection Act of 2021
